metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7222 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The KVM implementation in the Linux kernel through 4.20.5 has an Information Leak. Felix Wilhelm discovered that an information leak vulnerability existed in the KVM subsystem of the Linux kernel, when nested virtualization is used. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (host system memory to a guest VM).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

notes.Note: tyhicks> Ubuntu kernels do not enable nested KVM virtualization by default and are unaffected by this flaw in the default configuration. However, installing QEMU results in nested KVM support to be enabled via the /etc/modprobe.d/qemu-system-x86.conf file. To ensure that nested virtualization is not enabled, verify that the /sys/module/kvm_intel/parameters/nested file contains "N".
